intro: Dichapetalum andamanicum, commonly known as the Andaman white flower, is a rare flowering plant native to the Andaman Islands. It belongs to the family Dichapetalaceae and is characterized by its distinctive white, showy flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and has simple, alternate leaves. Its flowers are usually arranged in clusters and are known for their fragrant, nectar-rich petals. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
